title: Fukuraicho, Tunnel Roji no Otoko
title_japanese: 福来町、トンネル路地の男
synopsis: A mysterious man, wearing a mask with eyes on it, is unable to go anywhere because he is plugged into an electrical outlet. He sits in an alleyway while various people visit him, curious about who he is and why he is there.
background:
Premiered at the 12th annual Japan Media Arts Festival in 2008, as Kenji Iwaisawa's first work. It did not win an award, but was selected by the judges as a notable work.
It later had a US premiere at the 13th New York International Children's Film Festival in 2010, during the "Heebie Jeebies" program, which showcased horror-themed short films.
